lcInstruction.p: A reference topic answers the question “What is it?” Reference topics typically contain descriptive facts, such as a table identifying items on a software screen or an alphabetical list of commands available in a programming language.
Reference topics do not include steps or concepts. Reference topics are similar to dictionary entries and provide facts only.

The reference topic has a required title. Other common elements used in a reference topic include:
shortdesc (short description)
refbody (the body of the reference topic)
properties
refsyn
